definition: to track sth to its roots
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
root/source/origin
to trace sth back to its origin
to trace sth back to its source/to get to the bottom of sth
to pursue sth back to its origins/to trace back to the source/to get to the bottom of sth
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
see 追根溯源[zhui1 gen1 su4 yuan2]
lit. to dig up the root/to get to the heart of (the matter)
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
see 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]
to seek/to pursue/to investigate
to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation)/to see through to the nub
see 追本溯源[zhui1 ben3 su4 yuan2]
the whys and the wherefores/the detailed story/root cause
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
